p: A virus isolated from mosquitoes in Tibet, China in 2009 was identified as a novel species of the genus Orbivirus ( 244). Designated as Tibet Orbivirus (TIBOV), the virus has been obtained from mosquitoes and Culicoides biting midges in other regions of mainland China ( 86, 245, 246). Phylogenetic analysis of inner core (T2) protein of known orbiviruses demonstrated that TIBOV is clearly categorized into the Culicoides-borne group with BTV, EHDV, and PALV ( 244, 245). The amino acid sequence diversity among outermost capsid proteins of TIBOV isolates indicated that the species consists of at least two serotypes ( 246). The neutralization antibodies to TIBOV were detected in cattle reared in the southern border region of mainland China ( 246).
